ovdesc.p: This table is used to produce portfolio valuation reports on-line. Each user may enter his own parameters for the production of either individual reports for a customer, or for all the customers of a particular DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER.
The user also has the ability to determine which reports are to be produced.
For confidentiality purpose, only customers belonging to the account officer whose code is used as the key to the current record will be allowed in it.

desc.p: Specifies which month is to be used as the starting point for the cashflow report.
This field is only used in the production of the cashflow report, and is the starting point from which a 3 month cashflow projection will be based.
1-2 numeric characters (Optional Input)
Must be in range 01-12.
Default is current month.
YES/NO flag allowing the User to Choose whether they wish to Physically produce a Valuations report or not.
Valid Values : YES or NO. - Default is YES.
Specifies which report/s is/are to be produced for the accounts specified in the SEC.ACC.NO field.

1-2 numeric characters. (Mandatory Input) Examples: If, for example, the user wants reports 1 & 4 for clients who's portfolio numbers are 1001-1, 1002-1, 31245-2, and report 6 for all of their clients, the input would be as follows: 1.1 REPORT.TYPE 1 2.1.1 SEC.ACC.NO 1001-1 2.1.2 SEC.ACC.NO 1002-1 2.1.3 SEC.ACC.NO 31245-2 1.2 REPORT.TYPE 4 2.2.1 SEC.ACC.NO 1001-1 2.2.2 SEC.ACC.NO 1002-1 2.2.3 SEC.ACC.NO 31245-2 1.3 REPORT.TYPE 6 2.3.1 SEC.ACC.NO ALL
Must exist on the SC.REPORT.TYPE tableor on the SC.VAL.REPORT if the Valuation sub routine entered on the SC.PARAMETER record is SC.VAL.REPORT$RUN.
Specifies the portfolios for which the reports are required.

'ALL' or 1-10 numeric characters in the format 'nnnnnn-nnn' (Mandatory Input) Examples: If, for example, the user wants reports 1 & 4 for clients who's portfolio numbers are 1001-1, 1002-1, 31245-2, and report 6 for all of their clients, the input would be as follows: 1.1 REPORT.TYPE 1 2.1.1 SEC.ACC.NO 1001-1 2.1.2 SEC.ACC.NO 1002-1 2.1.3 SEC.ACC.NO 31245-2 1.2 REPORT.TYPE 4 2.2.1 SEC.ACC.NO 1001-1 2.2.2 SEC.ACC.NO 1002-1 2.2.3 SEC.ACC.NO 31245-2 1.3 REPORT.TYPE 6 2.3.1 SEC.ACC.NO ALL
Must either be 'ALL' or must exist on the SEC.ACC.MASTER file.
Specifies the code of the account officer for whom the reports are to be produced.
The user should enter their own account officer code, so that if 'ALL' is entered in the SEC.ACC.NO field, all portfolios relating to that account officer specified will be selected.
1-4 numeric characters. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table.
This field is not currently used.
Specifies whether the report is required for the bank's own use, or whether it is to be sent to the customer.
This field is reserved for future use.
Y or N(o) only (Optional Input)
Default is 'NO'
Indicates whether the portfolios are to be re-valued, set Y, or whether the last valuation data is to be used, leave blank.
